check syslog)'.format(repl))) elif delta.seconds >= limits[1]: results.append((STATUS_CRIT, "'{}' replication lag is {} " "seconds".format(repl, delta.seconds))) "'{}' replication lag is {} " "seconds".format(repl, delta.seconds))) if not repl_failures: pass elif repl_failures >= limits[3]: results.append((STATUS_CRIT, "{} replication failures".format(repl_failures))) elif repl_failures >= limits[2]: results.append((STATUS_WARN, "{} replication failures".format(repl_failures))) elif repl_failures == -1 and delta: # XXX(aluria): only raised if repl lag err was not triggered results.append((STATUS_CRIT, "replication failures counter is NULL " "(check syslog)")) help='Hostname to query') parser.add_argument('-p', '--port', dest='port', default='6000', type=int, help='Port number') type=int, nargs=4, help='Check replication status', metavar=('lag_warn', 'lag_crit', 'failures_warn', 'failures_crit')) help='Compare server rings md5sum with local copy') print('You must use -r or -m switch') print("CRITICAL: {}".format(crits)) print("WARNING: {}".format(warns)) print("UNKNOWN: {}".format(unknowns)) print("OK")

subject: Disable facts on publish-openstack-artifacts jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-16 15:59:31.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/publish/openstack-artifacts.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7d1397f7df11a3334dd72c213ed46a95b822e89d', 'message': "Disable facts on publish-openstack-artifacts jobs

While we do have fact caching enabled by default, they are not shared
across job runs. So, if we are doing add_host: tarballs.o.o each time
we upload something, it might be over kill to do gather facts each
time.

Right now, we don't use any facts, so we can stop collecting them.

Change-Id: I4a34c0c9c48b586dc24cb512c3a735e987deafbf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Disable facts on publish-openstack-artifacts jobs

While we do have fact caching enabled by default, they are not shared
across job runs. So, if we are doing add_host: tarballs.o.o each time
we upload something, it might be over kill to do gather facts each
time.

Right now, we don't use any facts, so we can stop collecting them.

Change-Id: I4a34c0c9c48b586dc24cb512c3a735e987deafbf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/51/494251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable LBaaS2 in Horizon

Install the python-neutron-lbaas-dashboard package if Ocata or greater
to enable LBaas2 in Horizon.

This fix is for stable/17.02 only as a mere cherry-pick is not possible
due to the fact that CompareOpenStackReleases is not present in the
stable charm-helpers branch at the time of writing.

There is no harm in doing a fix specifically for this branch with the
old style of comparison.

Change-Id: I6ac9be8041791df2404369ba5e8cb5e4e18aaf4d
Closes-Bug: #1658105
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-openstack-dashboard refs/changes/32/494032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if release >= 'ocata': packages.append('python-neutron-lbaas-dashboard')

commit_message:
Manually check apparmor_status

The apparmor systemd unit file simply calls an old SysV init script
to load AppArmor profiles. The init script exits and systemd has no
idea if it's still running or not. This causes Ansible to start
the apparmor unit each time the playbook runs, which breaks the
idempotency checks.

This patch checks the apparmor_status output directly to see what the
status of AppArmor actually is. If the module is loaded, then we
should not try to start AppArmor with the unit file again.

This patch also includes the updates from the openstack-ansible-tests
repository that were included in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/488489/ so that the gate can be
unblocked.

Partial-Bug: 1710675
Change-Id: If253714d0ca4b5a3d324255751e6f6615ca75dde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening refs/changes/08/493908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mhayden): The systemd unit file for apparmor just calls an old SysV # init script and exits. It's not possible to ask systemd if apparmor is # running and if we tell systemd to start apparmor, it will tell us that it # started apparmor each time. This breaks idempotency and we check # apparmor_status directly as an alternative. - name: Check if apparmor is running command: apparmor_status register: apparmor_status_output when: - ansible_pkg_mgr in ['apt', 'zypper'] tags: - high - V-71989 - '"apparmor module is loaded" in apparmor_status_output.stdout'

commit_message:
Add target attribute to RPC endpoint class

oslo.messaging expects that if a 'target' attribute is present in an
endpoint it must be of type Target and specify a method filter.
SinkHole returns a method on any attribute access, which causes
oslo.messaging to fail when a SinkHole method is accessed.

Change-Id: I1568503c7b365e818861dc8b5f605eaa2d0e1f54
Closes-Bug: 1709625
Related-Bug: 1709131
Related-Bug: 1705351
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/492165/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: target = None

commit_message:
Create site_zuulv3_dev secret

This creates a new secret containing information about zuulv3-dev.o.o. SSH
user, FQDN, SSH known_hosts and SSH private key.

Job publish-openstack-artifacts also needs access to site_zuulv3_dev
secret.

This was encrypted using:

  tools/encrypt_secret.py --infile zuulv3_dev_id_rsa http://zuulv3.openstack.org gerrit openstack-infra/project-config

Change-Id: I37add28e250875a0217ac061c3263c8d9c3832b6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Minor improvements to the translation document

This patch improves the syntax highlighting of code examples in the
translation doc, and bolds a couple of important references.

Change-Id: Ib5d396fdb40cf8f2f735a39373b2d1d64a4520e7
Implements: blueprint pike-docs-overhaul
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/09/493809/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: folder and the ``openstack_dashboard`` folder. We use the AngularJS extractor for JavaScript and HTML files and the Django extractor for Python and Django templates; both extractors are Babel plugins... note::.. code-block:: python from django.utils.translation import pgettext from django.utils.translation import ugettext as _ from django.utils.translation import ungettext class IndexView(request): # Single example _("Images") # Plural example ungettext( "there is %(count)d object", "there are %(count)d objects", count) % { "count": count } # Interpolated example mood = "wonderful" output = _("Today is %(mood)s.") % mood # Contextual markers pgettext("the month name", "May") # Translators: This message appears as a comment for translators! ugettext("Welcome translators.") .. note:: alias for gettext or any of its variants... code-block:: django.. code-block:: javascript .module(myModule) myCtrl.$inject = [ "horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext" ]; function myCtrl(gettext) { var translated = gettext("Images"); } .. warning:: For localization in AngularJS files, use the AngularJS service ``horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext``. Ensure that the injected dependency is named ``gettext`` or ``nggettext``. If you do not do this, message extraction will not work properly!.. code-block:: html {$ ‘Filter example’| translate $}.. note:: **#openstack-horizon** room or report a bug. Also note that you should avoid embedding#. Make sure your .pot files are up to date .. code-block:: console $ tox -e manage -- extract_messages #. Run the pseudo tool to create pseudo translations. This example replaces the German translation with a pseudo translation .. code-block:: console $ tox -e manage -- update_catalog de --pseudo #. Compile the catalog .. code-block:: console $ tox -e manage -- compilemessages .. code-block:: console $ tox -e runserver `Use string formatting variables, never perform string concatenationThose should **not** be submitted for review.
deleted_lines: folder and the ``openstack_dashboard`` folder. We use the AngularJS extractor for JavaScript and HTML files and the Django extractor for Python and Django templates; both extractors are Babel plugins... Note :::: from django.utils.translation import pgettext from django.utils.translation import ugettext as _ from django.utils.translation import ungettext class IndexView(request): # Single example _("Images") # Plural example ungettext( 'there is %(count)d object', 'there are %(count)d objects', count) % { 'count': count } # Interpolated example mood = ‘wonderful’ output = _('Today is %(mood)s.') % mood # Contextual markers pgettext("the month name", "May") # Translators: This message appears as a comment for translators! ugettext("Welcome translators.") .. Note :: alias for gettext or any of its variants. In Django, you have to explicitly spell it out with the import statement.:::: .module(…) myCtrl.$inject = [‘horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext’]; function myCtrl(gettext) { var translated = gettext(‘Images’); } .. warning :: For localization in AngularJS files, use the AngularJS service ``horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext``. Ensure that the injected dependency is named ``gettext`` or ``nggettext``. If you do not do this, message extraction will not work properly! :: {$ ‘Filter example’|translate $}.. Note :: #openstack-horizon room or report a bug. Also note that you should avoid embedding#. Make sure your .pot files are up to date: ``tox -e manage -- extract_messages`` #. Run the pseudo tool to create pseudo translations. For example, to replace the German translation with a pseudo translation: ``tox -e manage -- update_catalog de --pseudo`` #. Compile the catalog: ``tox -e manage -- compilemessages`` `"Use string formatting variables, never perform string concatenation"Those should not be submitted for review.

commit_message:
Sync neutron db with OVN southbound db

Presently we do not sync neutron db with OVN southbound db.
This patch does that. Also when an existing Neutron ML2 OVS
deployment is migrated to OVN, there could be router ports
of type DVR and HA. We need to consider these router port types
during sync.

Change-Id: I8628b32f70aa98d45cb340839aace180cf1d9c80
Closes-bug: #1629076
Co-authored-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/20/427020/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if p.port_type in [n_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF, n_const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE, n_const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_HA_INTF]]

subject: Render VIPs dynamically based on network_data.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-21 23:36:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ff34544c50e208f368bee56b5e1cd572ff112d6b', 'message': 'Render VIPs dynamically based on network_data.yaml

This change modifies the templates to dynamically define the VIPs
based on network_data.yaml. If a network is defined and marked
with "vip: true" in network_data.yaml, it will be included in the
overcloud.yaml which defines the deployment-level resources.

This should make it possible to create custom networks and
use them for services which use high-availability through VIPs.

Depends-On: If074f87494a46305c990a0ea332c7b576d3c6ed8
Change-Id: I71339a6ac41133e95dbc3f93abb7a9fdeb0f2da0

commit_message:
Render VIPs dynamically based on network_data.yaml

This change modifies the templates to dynamically define the VIPs
based on network_data.yaml. If a network is defined and marked
with "vip: true" in network_data.yaml, it will be included in the
overcloud.yaml which defines the deployment-level resources.

This should make it possible to create custom networks and
use them for services which use high-availability through VIPs.

Also, extraconfig/nova_metadata/krb-service-pricipals.yaml
was modified to dynamically produce the FQDN map for VIPs on
isolated networks, to match overcloud.j2.yaml.

Depends-On: If074f87494a46305c990a0ea332c7b576d3c6ed8
Depends-On: Iab8aca2f1fcaba0c8f109717a4b3068f629c9aab
Partially-implements: blueprint composable-networks
Closes-bug: 1667104
Change-Id: I71339a6ac41133e95dbc3f93abb7a9fdeb0f2da0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/486260/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add three more transformations

The os-service-types project generates some internal mappings that are
useful. Generate them here on publication so that others can benefit as
well.

Change-Id: Ib761cf9de875e7b80404797d4aa8d294ca56347a

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/82/493982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WARNING,def import_key(key): """Import an ASCII Armor key. /!\ A Radix64 format keyid is also supported for backwards compatibility, but should never be used; the key retrieval mechanism is insecure and subject to man-in-the-middle attacks voiding all signature checks using that key. :param keyid: The key in ASCII armor format, including BEGIN and END markers. key = key.strip() if '-' in key or '\n' in key: # Send everything not obviously a keyid to GPG to import, as # we trust its validation better than our own. eg. handling # comments before the key. if ('-----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----' in key and '-----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----' in key): log("Importing ASCII Armor PGP key", level=DEBUG) with NamedTemporaryFile() as keyfile: with open(keyfile.name, 'w') as fd: fd.write(key) fd.write("\n") cmd = ['apt-key', 'add', keyfile.name] try: subprocess.check_call(cmd) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: error = "Error importing PGP key '{}'".format(key) log(error) raise GPGKeyError(error) else: raise GPGKeyError("ASCII armor markers missing from GPG key") else: # We should only send things obviously not a keyid offsite # via this unsecured protocol, as it may be a secret or part # of one. log("PGP key found (looks like Radix64 format)", level=WARNING) log("INSECURLY importing PGP key from keyserver; " "full key not provided.", level=WARNING)
deleted_lines: def import_key(keyid): """Import a key in either ASCII Armor or Radix64 format. `keyid` is either the keyid to fetch from a PGP server, or the key in ASCII armor foramt. :param keyid: String of key (or key id). key = keyid.strip() if (key.startswith('-----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----') and key.endswith('-----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----')): log("Importing ASCII Armor PGP key", level=DEBUG) with NamedTemporaryFile() as keyfile: with open(keyfile.name, 'w') as fd: fd.write(key) fd.write("\n") cmd = ['apt-key', 'add', keyfile.name] try: subprocess.check_call(cmd) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: error = "Error importing PGP key '{}'".format(key) log(error) raise GPGKeyError(error) else: log("PGP key found (looks like Radix64 format)", level=DEBUG) log("Importing PGP key from keyserver", level=DEBUG)

commit_message:
Update amulet tests for internal-dns

Upate amulet tests to check for internal-dns ml2 enablement.
This change enables ml2-internal-dns for all supported
deployments (>= mitaka) and validates the config and relation
data.

Change-Id: I40f269b6648bfbdbf8fb77dc8cb713f8c1376ed7
Depends-On: I4b136fbe8056f4c3e4813ce97fb632c01ce14c5e
Implements: blueprint internal-dns

subject: jenkins: jobs: ansible-role-jobs: Increase job timeout to 90 minutes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 18:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/24f05bf5deef71133f3778949d7ea1a111680bbc', 'message': 'jenkins: jobs: ansible-role-jobs: Increase job timeout to 90 minutes

We are seeing a lot of failures lately due to job timeouts. It appears
that jobs got more complex over time so these timeouts do not
necessarily mean that the job is stuck. For example the following job

2017-08-15 15:08:55.607415 | [Zuul] Launched by zl07
[...]
2017-08-15 16:03:01.405355 | TASK [Run functional tests for swift] ******************************************
2017-08-15 16:03:01.428393 | Tuesday 15 August 2017  16:03:01 +0000 (0:00:00.062)       0:51:42.612 ********
2017-08-15 16:14:02.430223 | [Zuul] Job timed out, result: FAILURE

took about an hour to reach the point of actually executing the
functional tests so the failure does not look legit. As such it might
be better to increase the timeout again so we can give the CI jobs more
time to finish.

Change-Id: I3562263beb5d3b8b3e164f96ae48f2cb2dddace5
'}]
commit_message:
jenkins: jobs: ansible-role-jobs: Increase job timeout to 90 minutes

We are seeing a lot of failures lately due to job timeouts. It appears
that jobs got more complex over time so these timeouts do not
necessarily mean that the job is stuck. For example the following job

2017-08-15 15:08:55.607415 | [Zuul] Launched by zl07
[...]
2017-08-15 16:03:01.405355 | TASK [Run functional tests for swift] ******************************************
2017-08-15 16:03:01.428393 | Tuesday 15 August 2017  16:03:01 +0000 (0:00:00.062)       0:51:42.612 ********
2017-08-15 16:14:02.430223 | [Zuul] Job timed out, result: FAILURE

took about an hour to reach the point of actually executing the
functional tests so the failure does not look legit. As such it might
be better to increase the timeout again so we can give the CI jobs more
time to finish.

Change-Id: I3562263beb5d3b8b3e164f96ae48f2cb2dddace5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/86/493986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timeout: 90

commit_message:
Add --set argument to prepare command

This new argument will allow special ceph variables to be added to the
template file overcloud_containers.yaml.j2. For example if the
following existed in the template file:
  {% set ceph_namespace=ceph_namespace or "ceph" %}
  {% set ceph_daemon=ceph_daemon or "daemon" %}
  {% set ceph_tag=ceph_tag or "tag-build-master-jewel-centos-7" %}
  - imagename: "{{ ceph_namespace }}/{{ ceph_daemon }}:{{ ceph_tag }}"

Then the --set argument will allow making substitutions on these
values, for example:
  openstack overcloud container image prepare \
      --namespace tripleoupstream \
      --tag latest \
      --images-file overcloud_containers.yaml \
      --set ceph_namespace=myceph \
      --set ceph_tag=latest \
      --env-file $HOME/docker_registry.yaml

Change-Id: Ie12dbab0f4d7f20d14a764abb9095fd8b326c700
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/83/489083/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--set', 'ceph_namespace=myceph', '--set', 'ceph_image=mydaemon', '--set', 'ceph_tag=mytag', tag='passed-ci', ceph_image='mydaemon', ceph_namespace='myceph', ceph_tag='mytag'

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 18:10:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/9fe83b2bf774974439ff9a9ecfcc465a9bbb72fd', 'message': "Add OS::Swift::TempURL resource

The TempURL resource is meant to create Swift temporary URL
resources. The only action it really implements is _create(),
as it happens with RandomString to which it is very similar
as it simply outputs a temporary URL built from the needed
properties, doesn't create any actual resource in Swift except
for setting a secret on the published object.

Change-Id: I8f819a8a53850cb0952865d3b43049682b1c44e3
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-03 22:44:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/cf32d0d649039338d74ddd0ce0b2a3b52dcc7ded', 'message': "Add OS::Swift::TempURL resource

The TempURL resource is meant to create Swift temporary URL
resources. The only action it really implements is _create(),
as it happens with RandomString to which it is very similar
as it simply outputs a temporary URL built from the needed

commit_message:
Add OS::Swift::TempURL resource

The TempURL resource is meant to create Swift temporary URL
resources. The only action it really implements is _create(),
as it happens with RandomString to which it is very similar
as it simply outputs a temporary URL built from the needed
properties, doesn't create any actual resource in Swift except
for setting a secret on the published object.

Change-Id: I8f819a8a53850cb0952865d3b43049682b1c44e3

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging import string import sys import six from heat.common import exception from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.engine import attributes from heat.engine import constraints from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import support LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class SwiftTempURL(resource.Resource): """A resource which generates a Swift temporary URL. Temporary URLs are useful to give access to objects from Swift accounts which do not have public access to Keystone. """ support_status = support.SupportStatus('UNSUPPORTED') PROPERTIES = ( METHOD, SECONDS, PATH, KEY, ) = ( 'method', 'seconds', 'path', 'key', ) ATTRIBUTES = ( URL, ) = ( 'url', ) default_client_name = 'swift' properties_schema = { METHOD: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('Allowed methods to the TempURL.'), default='GET', constraints=[ constraints.AllowedValues(['GET', 'HEAD', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE']), ], ), SECONDS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.INTEGER, _('Validity, in seconds, for the TempURL.'), default=3600, ), PATH: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The tenant-relative path to be published.'), required=True, ), KEY: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The secret key for the TempURL.'), required=True, ), } attributes_schema = { URL: attributes.Schema( _('The TempURL generated by this resource. This value is ' 'also available by referencing the resource.'), ), } def handle_create(self): method = self.properties[self.METHODS] seconds = self.properties[self.SECONDS] path = self.properties[self.PATH] key = self.properties[self.KEY] if string.count(path, '/') > 1: container_name = string.split(path, '/') object_name = string.split(path, '/', 1)[1] else: container = path object_name = '' tempurl = self.client_plugin().get_temp_url(container_name, object_name, seconds, method) self.data_set('url', tempurl) self.resource_id_set(self.physical_resource_name()) def _resolve_attribute(self, name): if name == self.URL: return self.data().get(self.URL) def get_reference_id(self): if self.resource_id is not None: return self.data().get('url') else: return six.text_type(self.name) def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Swift::TempURL': SwiftTempURL, }

commit_message:
Change default swift name to object-storage

The other storage services end in storage - as does the swift docs URL.
Change it to match.

Change-Id: I766c85a126bbac607f7a0a42ca210f5cab8ba67b

commit_message:
Add test the exposes duplicate roles in token

This is a WIP test case that attempts to recreate an issue with
duplication of role assignments. In federated cases, it's been
observed that a token scoped to a project might contain the same role
twice. It doesn't make sense to return
role: [{'name': 'member'}, {'name': 'member'}] when once is enough.

This is possible because federated tokens are populated with roles
implied through groups (e.g. the mapping) and they can also consist
of direct role assignments via the shadow user concept.

Part of the problem is that this appears to be a transient issue.
I can run the test case multiple times but it doesn't fail
consistently.

Change-Id: I4e20a77b6bbb751d0f1c462930c48e803c8e6a48
Related-Bug: 1701324

added_lines: @utils.wip('This fails intermittently and is related to bug 1701324. ' 'The intended behavior is that the roles in token token will ' 'be unique, since there is no reason to advertize the two of ' 'the same role in a single token.' def test_scope_to_project_with_duplicate_roles_returns_single_role(self): r = self.v3_create_token(self.TOKEN_SCOPE_PROJECT_EMPLOYEE_FROM_ADMIN) # Even though the process of obtaining a token shows that there is a # role assignment on a project, we should attempt to create a duplicate # assignment somehwere. Do this by creating a direct role assignment # with each role against the projec the token was scoped to. user_id = r.json_body['token']['user']['id'] project_id = r.json_body['token']['project']['id'] for role in r.json_body['token']['roles']: self.assignment_api.create_grant( role_id=role['id'], user_id=user_id, project_id=project_id ) # Ensure all roles in the token are unique even though we know there # should be duplicate role assignment between the assertions about # groups and the direct role assignments we just created. r = self.v3_create_token(self.TOKEN_SCOPE_PROJECT_EMPLOYEE_FROM_ADMIN) known_role_ids = [] for role in r.json_body['token']['roles']: self.assertNotIn(role['id'], known_role_ids) known_role_ids.append(role['id'])

commit_message:
mark convergence_engine as deprecated

The convergence_engine is default since Mitaka and the non-convergence
mode actually does not work anymore, so mark it as deprecated in order
to be able to remove it in Pike.

Change-Id: I69358f815dc11056efdde64138468c53ace67514

Don't translate exceptions w/ no message

These messages only contain variable references,
so there is nothing to translate.

Trivial Fix

will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid usingg
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I4b541390f6101619ed43cfdf24d9c693413cc853
